Backend

All backend classes and functions.

Main

Main program. Makes sure only one instance is run. Created on 2024-12-01 by kins3i

Classes and functions for main functionalities

Main GUI class.

class app_backend.gui_backend.AppFnc(master: App)[source]

Class handling backend for GUI.

Calls every external backend class or function to relieve GUI code.

get_battery()[source]

Calls reading battery info on all BLE devices.

Returns:

[address, battery info]

Return type:

list of responses like

Calls reading device config on all BLE devices.

Returns:

[address, config]

Return type:

list of responses like

Calls GUI for handling device serial info.

Calls GUI for handling device full info.

Returns:

[address, battery info]

Return type:

response like

[address, battery info]

Calls reading Wi-Fi config on all BLE devices.

Returns:

[address, Wi-Fi config]

Return type:

list of responses like

on_close()[source]

Function called when closing GUI.

Gracefully ends all processes on BLE and TCP. Prints last BLE measurement (if exists).

one_connect(address)[source]

Calls connect function on BLE device.

Returns:

[BleakClient, Device] or [None, None] when error is caught.

one_disconnect(address)[source]

Calls disconnect function on BLE device.

scan()[source]

Runs BLE scanner.

Invokes action based on string argument.

Calls writing and reading device config on all BLE devices.

Returns:

[address, config]

Return type:

list of responses like

Invokes stop of data receiving.

Module for joining Bleak and TCP client.

class app_backend.device.Device(client_ble, address_ble, address_wifi)[source]

Class for connecting BLE and Wi-Fi client and managing notifies.

Allows connecting BLE client with Wi-Fi client, manages notifies and parses measurement data.

BleakClient

address_ble

list[int]

list[int]

async_data()[source]

Starts asyncio loop for data notify.

async_device_status()[source]

Starts asyncio loop for device status notify.

async_update_status()[source]

Starts asyncio loop for update status notify.

get_update_status_notify()[source]

Returns update status list.

start_notifies()[source]

Starts all notify readings.

Starts and awaits on all notifies from devices. Every notify is awaited in different thread.

stop_all_notifies()[source]

Sets flags for gracefully stopping all notifies.

Returns:

1

Module for handling BLE actions.

class app_backend.ble_main.Bluetooth[source]

Class for managing BLE functionalities. Allows scanning, connecting, disconnecting and using all BLE characteristics.

scanned_devices

list all BleakScanner instances

client_list

list all BleakClient class instances

client_device_list

list all Device class instances

nr_of_devices

int number of devices in scanned_devices

wifi_clients

None, list if not None, list contains all devices connected via Wi-Fi to server

async all_connect()[source]

Invokes connect function for all scanned devices.

Raises:

ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting connecting single device

async all_disconnect()[source]

Invokes disconnect function for all connected devices.

on_close()[source]

Gracefully stops all BleakClients notifies.

async read_battery(client: BleakClient = None)[source]

Reads battery information from device.

Parameters:

client – BleakClient, optional

Returns:

list of MAC address and response from device or list of lists of MAC address and response from all clients.

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting reading GATT

  • service. –

async read_config(client: BleakClient = None)[source]

Reads basic configuration of device by GATT characteristic.

Parameters:

client – BleakClient, optional: if exists, reads configuration from specified client; if it doesn’t exist, reads configuration for all BLE clients

Returns:

list of MAC address and response from device or list of lists of MAC address and response from all clients.

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting reading GATT

  • service. –

async scan()[source]

Scans all devices in advertisement mode and finds only chosen devices; makes sure no device is listed more than one time. Updates number of scanned devices

async single_connect(address)[source]

Creates and connects BleakClient.

Creates and adds to list Device instance; if Wi-Fi client already exists, pairs up BleakClient wif Wi-Fi client inside Device instance.

Parameters:

address – str MAC address of BLE device to connect

Returns:

Tuple of BleakClient instance and Device instance corresponding to returned BleakClient instance.

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting connecting

  • single device or reading 2 characteristics. –

async single_disconnect(address)[source]

Disconnects BleakClient by address and destroys corresponding Device instance.

Parameters:

address – str MAC address of BLE device to disconnect

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting disconnecting

  • single device. –

async write_action(action: int)[source]

Writes GATT characteristic for action of device.

Parameters:

action – int, optional

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting writing

  • GATT service. –

async write_config(client: BleakClient = None, **kwargs)[source]

Writes basic configuration and reads same characteristic after.

Writes basic configuration of device by GATT characteristic and reads same characteristic after. Sets list of parameters in Device instance corresponding to MAC address

Parameters:

  • kwargs

  • client – BleakClient, optional

Returns:

list of MAC address and response from device or list of lists of MAC address and response from all clients.

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting writing GATT

  • service. –

async write_config_update(firmware: int, upd_nr: list = None, client: BleakClient = None)[source]

Writes update parameters.

Parameters:

  • firmware – int

  • upd_nr – list

  • client – BleakClient

Returns:

If client is defined and value error or exception is caught, returns -5.

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting writing GATT

  • service. –

async write_wifi(ssid: str = 'telvis115', psw: str = 'telvis115', ip: list = None, port: int = 8090, client: BleakClient = None)[source]

Writes Wi-Fi configuration to device.

Parameters:

  • ssid – str

  • psw – str

  • ip – list

  • port – int

  • client – BleakClient, optional

Returns:

If client is defined, returns 0 after completing successfully GATT writing. Returns -5 if value error or exception is caught.

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when awaiting writing GATT

  • service. –

Module providing creating and handling TCP server.

class app_backend.wifi_server.WiFi[source]

Class for creating and handle Wi-Fi servers and clients.

Creates server, listens for clients and allows reading and writing to client’s socket buffer. Server does keepAlive checks for idle clients.

client_flag

bool

clients

list

list_of_threads

list

listening_clients

list

dev_classes
s

socket.socket

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when creating and binding

  • socket. –

create_server()[source]

Listens on socket for new clients.

Listens for new clients. After catching client, reads header and creates connection with BLE client (if exists). If client got accepted on new port, every instance is updated.

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when accepting new clients

  • or parsing header. –

listen_on_socket()[source]

Creates new thread for every eligible Wi-Fi client.

Checks if client is already on listen. If not, starts new thread for client

Raises:

  • ValueError, Exception – error occurred when creating threads or

  • checking existing threads. –

on_close()[source]

Gracefully joins clients’ threads and closes server.

Sets flags to graceful ending clients listening, joins clients threads and prints number of clients connected before closing server. Closes clients sockets.

on_new_client(conn, address, device=None)[source]

Listens and interprets data

Listen on established socket buffer. Listens without blocking thread. If device is passed, gets configuration data for parsing received data. After catching connection error, removes client form list. Reacts with graceful and hard disconnect.

Parameters:

  • conn – socket.socket object to send and receive data

  • address – tuple ip address and port received by client

  • device – Device, optional instance of class with BLE and Wi-Fi client references

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – error occurred on connection between sockets.

  • select.error – error occurred while waiting on data

  • Exception – error occurred on parsing data.

static read_response(timeout=False, client=None)[source]

Reads data from client

Reads data on demand with blocking or non-blocking way. Reads data from chosen client or all existing clients.

Parameters:

  • timeout – bool choose if thread will be blocked while waiting for data

  • client – socket.socket client object to receive data

Returns:

client response or list of clients responses

Raises:

  • ConnectionError – error occurred on connection status between sockets.

  • socket.error – error occurred when receiving data.

  • Exception – error occurred while handling lists

send_with_response(msg: bytearray, client=None)[source]

Sends data and waits for response

Sends data to chosen client (or all available clients) and waits for client’s sent data in response.

Parameters:

  • msg – bytearray data to send

  • client – socket.socket client object to send and receive data

Returns:

client response or list of clients responses

Raises:

socket.error – error occurred when sending or receiving data.

app_backend.wifi_server.calc_crc16(input_arr: bytes)[source]

Calculate CRC16 from array.

Parameters:

input_arr – bytes data to calculate crc16 from

Returns:

Calculated CRC.
